description: From Latin refrāctum, neuter form of refrāctus, the past participle of refringō, itself from re- (“again”) + frangō (“I break”).

verbs.description: refract (third-person singular simple present refracts, present participle refracting, simple past and past participle refracted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, of light) To change direction as a result of entering a different medium
(transitive, optics) To cause (light) to change direction as a result of entering a different medium.
